{{cpp/chrono/time_point/title|time_since_epoch}}
{{cpp/chrono/time_point/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++11|notes={{mark constexpr since c++14}}|
duration time_since_epoch() const;
}}
{{dcl rev end}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a {{lc|std::chrono::duration|duration}} representing the amount of time between {{c|*this}} and the {{tt|clock}}'s epoch.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
The amount of time between this {{tt|time_point}} and the {{tt|clock}}'s epoch.

===Example===
{{example
|p=true
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;ctime&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    const auto p0 = std::chrono::time_point&lt;std::chrono::system_clock&gt;{};
    const auto p1 = std::chrono::system_clock::now();
    const auto p2 = p1 - std::chrono::hours(24);
 
    std::time_t epoch_time = std::chrono::system_clock::to_time_t(p0);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "epoch: " &lt;&lt; std::ctime(&amp;epoch_time);
    std::time_t today_time = std::chrono::system_clock::to_time_t(p1);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "today: " &lt;&lt; std::ctime(&amp;today_time);
 
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "hours since epoch: "
              &lt;&lt; std::chrono::duration_cast&lt;std::chrono::hours&gt;(
                     p1.time_since_epoch()).count() 
              &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "yesterday, hours since epoch: "
              &lt;&lt; std::chrono::duration_cast&lt;std::chrono::hours&gt;(
                     p2.time_since_epoch()).count() 
              &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
epoch: Thu Jan  1 00:00:00 1970
today: Fri Jun 30 10:44:11 2017
hours since epoch: 416338
yesterday, hours since epoch: 416314
}}
